TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit TextLine extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Provides an abstract class for supporting formatting services to a line of text.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float64 pixelsPerDip) cil managed

Docs.param: `pixelsPerDip` should be set to the TextSource's PixelsPerDip value.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor must be called for every class that is inherited from <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine>.

Docs.summary: Gets the distance from the top to the baseline of the current object.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the baseline distance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine Collapse(class System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextCollapsingProperties[] collapsingPropertiesList) cil managed

Docs.param: A list of objects that represent the collapsed text properties.
Docs.summary: Create a collapsed line based on collapsed text properties.
Docs.returns: A value that represents a collapsed line that can be displayed.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of characters following the last character of the line that may trigger reformatting of the current line.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the number of characters.

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator for enumerating objects in the .
Docs.returns: An enumerator that allows you to enumerate each object in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks By enumerating through the list of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.IndexedGlyphRun> objects, the text layout client can obtain glyph information for each text source character.

An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the number of characters of the specified range.
Docs.summary: Gets an array of bounding rectangles that represent the range of characters within a text line.
Docs.returns: A list of objects representing the bounding rectangle.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextCollapsedRange> GetTextCollapsedRanges() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of collapsed text ranges after a line has been collapsed.
Docs.returns: A list of objects that represent the collapsed text.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLineBreak GetTextLineBreak() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the state of the line when broken by line breaking process.
Docs.returns: A value that represents the line break.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The return value is `null` when the line ends at the end of the paragraph.
The text formatter client may pass the return value back as a parameter to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextFormatter.FormatLine%2A> method, which allows the value to be used when formatting the next line within the same paragraph.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextSpan`1<class System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextRun>> GetTextRunSpans() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of objects in a text span that are contained within a line.
Docs.returns: Gets a list of objects contained within a text span.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the line is collapsed.
Docs.value: , if the line is collapsed; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether content of the line overflows the specified paragraph width.
Docs.value: , it the line overflows the specified paragraph width; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the height of a line of text.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the text line height.

Docs.summary: Determines whether the text line is truncated in the middle of a word.
Docs.value: if the text line is truncated in the middle of a word; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The IsTruncated property value is set only when the <xref:System.Windows.TextWrapping> property of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextParagraphProperties> is set to <xref:System.Windows.TextWrapping>, and a single word is wider than the formatting paragraph width. In such situation, <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextFormatter> truncates the line in the middle of the word to honor the desired behavior specified by <xref:System.Windows.TextWrapping> setting.

Docs.summary: Gets the total number of positions of the current line.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the total number of positions of the current line.

Docs.summary: Gets the distance from the edge of the line's highest point to the baseline marker of the line.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the baseline distance of the marker.

Docs.summary: Gets the height of a marker for a list item.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the height of the marker.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of newline characters at the end of a line.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the number of newline characters.

Docs.summary: Gets the distance that black pixels extend beyond the bottom alignment edge of a line.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the overhang after distance.

Docs.summary: Gets the distance that black pixels extend prior to the left leading alignment edge of the line.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the overhang leading distance.

Docs.summary: Gets the distance that black pixels extend following the right trailing alignment edge of the line.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the overhang trailing distance.

Docs.summary: Get or sets the PixelsPerDip at which the text should be rendered.
Docs.value: The current PixelsPerDip value.

Docs.summary: Gets the distance from the start of a paragraph to the starting point of a line.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> value that represents the distance from the start of a paragraph to the starting point of a line.

Docs.summary: Gets the distance from the top to the baseline of the line of text.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> value that represents the text baseline distance.

Docs.summary: Gets the height of the text and any other content in the line.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The TextHeight may differ from the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine.Height%2A> property if the client specified the line height.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of whitespace code points beyond the last non-blank character in a line.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the number of whitespace code points beyond the last non-blank character in a line.

Docs.summary: Gets the width of a line of text, excluding trailing whitespace characters.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the text line width, excluding trailing whitespace characters.

Docs.summary: Gets the width of a line of text, including trailing whitespace characters.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the text line width, including trailing whitespace characters.
